verses.text: The whole congregation of the people of Israel assembled at Shiloh and set up the Tent of Meeting there. The land was subdued before them.
verses.comment: Shiloh becomes the worship center, replacing Gilgal.

verses.text: There remained among the people of Israel seven tribes which had not yet received their inheritance.
verses.comment: Previously, five tribes received inheritance east and west of Jordan.

verses.text: So Joshua said to the people of Israel, 'How long will you wait before going in to take possession of the land the LORD, the God of your fathers, has given you?'
verses.comment: Joshua admonishes inactivity in claiming the land.

verses.text: 'Pick three men from each tribe. I will send them out, and they will go throughout the land and write a description of it according to their inheritance; then return to me.'
verses.comment: Joshua orders a survey of the land.

verses.text: 'They shall divide it into seven portions. Judah will stay in their territory in the south, and the house of Joseph will stay in their territory in the north.'
verses.comment: Judah and Joseph’s tribes had already received land.

verses.text: 'Describe the land in seven portions, and bring it here to me. I will cast lots for you here before the LORD our God.'
verses.comment: Distribution by casting lots, seeking the LORD’s guidance.

verses.text: 'But the Levites have no portion among you, for the priesthood of the LORD is their inheritance. And Gad and Reuben and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance beyond the Jordan eastward, which Moses the servant of the LORD gave them.'
verses.comment: Levites receive cities, not land; eastern tribes already settled.

verses.text: So the men got up and went. Joshua instructed those who were to write a description of the land, saying, 'Go and walk through the land, write a description of it, and return to me. I will cast lots for you here before the LORD in Shiloh.'
verses.comment: Verse reiterates the surveying instructions.

verses.text: So the men went, passed through the land, and wrote a description of it by cities in seven portions in a book. Then they came to Joshua at the camp at Shiloh.
verses.comment: Surveyors record the regions in detail.

verses.text: Joshua cast lots for them at Shiloh before the LORD. There Joshua apportioned the land to the people of Israel, each to his portion.
verses.comment: The casting of lots is seen as God’s decision.

verses.text: The lot of the tribe of the people of Benjamin came up according to its clans; and the territory allotted to them fell between the tribes of Judah and Joseph.
verses.comment: Benjamin’s inheritance is geographically described.

verses.text: On the north side their boundary began at the Jordan. The boundary goes up to the side of Jericho on the north, up through the hill country westward, ending at the wilderness of Beth-aven.
verses.comment: Listing the starting boundaries for Benjamin.

verses.text: From there the boundary passes southward toward Luz (that is, Bethel), then goes down to Ataroth-addar, near the hill south of Lower Beth-horon.
verses.comment: Significant cities, Bethel (Luz), and Beth-horon referenced.

verses.text: Then the boundary bends around the western side to the south, from the hill facing Beth-horon southward, ending at Kiriath-baal (that is, Kiriath-jearim), a city of Judah. This is the west side.
verses.comment: Geographical note for the western boundary.

verses.text: On the southern side, the boundary begins at the outskirts of Kiriath-jearim, and the boundary goes out west to the spring of the waters of Nephtoah.
verses.comment: Water sources mark boundary points.

verses.text: Then the boundary goes down to the end of the mountain that faces the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, which is at the north end of the Valley of Rephaim. It goes down to the Valley of Hinnom, south of the Jebusite city, then downward to En-rogel.
verses.comment: Valley of Hinnom later called Gehenna in the NT.

verses.text: The boundary then goes north, to En-shemesh, and on to Geliloth, which is opposite the ascent of Adummim, and then goes down to the stone of Bohan, son of Reuben.
verses.comment: Landmarks used to mark ancient boundaries.

verses.text: Then it passes north to the slope facing the Arabah, goes down into the Arabah.
verses.comment: Arabah refers to the Jordan valley/desert region.

verses.text: The boundary passes on to the north of Beth-hoglah and ends at the northern bay of the Salt Sea, at the mouth of the Jordan. This is the southern boundary.
verses.comment: Salt Sea is the Dead Sea in modern terms.

verses.text: The Jordan forms its east side. This was the inheritance of the tribe of Benjamin, according to their clans, with its boundaries all around.
verses.comment: Final summary of boundary notes for Benjamin.

verses.text: Now the cities of the tribe of Benjamin according to their clans were: Jericho, Beth-hoglah, Emek-keziz,
verses.comment: Beginning the city list for Benjamin.

verses.text: Beth-arabah, Zemaraim, Bethel,
verses.comment: Several of these cities became significant later.

verses.text: Avvim, Parah, Ophrah,
verses.comment: Ophrah mentioned elsewhere in Judges.

verses.text: Chephar-ammoni, Ophni, and Geba—twelve cities with their villages.
verses.comment: Total of twelve cities named here.

verses.text: Gibeon, Ramah, Beeroth,
verses.comment: Gibeon plays a key role later in Israel’s history.

verses.text: Mizpah, Chephirah, Mozah,
verses.comment: Cities used as gathering places later (e.g., Mizpah).

verses.text: Rekem, Irpeel, Taralah,
verses.comment: Less is known about these cities; ancient locations.

verses.text: Zela, Haeleph, Jebus (that is, Jerusalem), Gibeah, and Kiriath—fourteen cities with their villages. This was the inheritance of Benjamin according to its clans.
verses.comment: Jebus was Jerusalem, later capital city; total of fourteen listed.
